alert.note: Alert for Forrest; Lamar; Marion (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 13 at 10:36PM CDT until April 13 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR MARION, FORREST AND LAMAR COUNTIES... At 1036 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible, mainly in southeast Marion and southern Forrest County. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hattiesburg, Petal, Columbia, West Hattiesburg, Kokomo, Holly Springs, Purvis, Sumrall, Pine Ridge, Oak Grove, Improve, Pinebur, Rawls Springs, Pickwick, Sunrise, Mclaurin, Morgantown and Macedonia. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
